channel.title: Getting compiler to work on windows 7
channel.description: everything i try doesn't work for windows 7. anyone know anything i have to change in Variables or got a code for compiler using Exion

item.title: Getting compiler to work on windows 7
item.dc:creator: @strd3stroyer strd3stroyer
item.description:
@strd3stroyer wrote:

First of all go to: Computer - C Drive - Program Files - Java - Jdk (whatever) - bin
Copy the bit at the top, for me it goes something like: C drive\Program Files \Java\Jdk 1.0.6.21 (or something\Bin
Copy that into your Compiler that says something like that.
Compile and it SHOULD work

Read full topic
item.source: Getting compiler to work on windows 7

item.title: Getting compiler to work on windows 7
item.dc:creator: @Daem Daem
item.description:
@Daem wrote:

[quote=“demps2k9, post:4, topic:410226”]Make sure you have JDK and also make sure your enviroment variables are correct.

CLASSPATH - CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_25\bin;%CLASSPATH%;
PATH - C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_25\bin[/quote]

how am i gonna use x86 if im using a windows 32 bit and dont have program files x86 lol

this is not helping me at all lol

Read full topic
item.source: Getting compiler to work on windows 7

item.title: Getting compiler to work on windows 7
item.dc:creator: @demps2k9 demps2k9
item.description:
@demps2k9 wrote:

Make sure you have JDK and also make sure your enviroment variables are correct.

CLASSPATH - CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_25\bin;%CLASSPATH%;
PATH - C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_25\bin

Read full topic

item.title: Getting compiler to work on windows 7
item.dc:creator: @Daem Daem
item.description:
@Daem wrote:

demps2k9:

If you already have a compiler, change /Program Files/ to /Program Files (x86)/

im not on a 64 bit im on 32.

Read full topic
